result.execSummary:
The defendant Khalid J Oates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of supervision.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must comply with all orders of the family court specifically regarding child support.   No contact with the victim, Clark Gas Station. No contact with the victim CA (person, property, residence or family) without the permission of CA and the agent. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected -

Defendant Khalid J Oates in court with attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Parties have received/reviewed PSI. The Court notes that the deft has denied involvement in the PSI and has taken no responsibility for the crimes. Defense indicates deft wishes to go forward with sentencing noting the deft contests the large amount of restitution. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $15,500.00

BTC: 15CF140 - Total sentence is 4 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES /CFTS- STAYED. 3 yrs prob consec to 17CF1075
       16CF690, Ct 1 - 9 mos RCJ, conc with 15CF140/CFTS - STAYED. 1 yr prob conc with 15CF140
                        Ct 4 - Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES, consec to 15CF140 - STAYED. 3 yrs prob conc with 15CF140 & Ct 1
       17CF1075, Ct 1 - 30 days RCJ/CFTS. Huber is granted for employment and child care with documentation, but not over max huber hours allowed. Costs, DNA sample & costs as well as RCAP fees
                           Ct 2 - 45 days RCJ consec to Ct 1. Huber as in Ct 1, costs, DNA sample & costs
                                           REPORT IN: February 3, 2018 by 8:30 am

Conditions:
60 days RCJ - STAYED
obey all rules and regs
restitution - $15,500.00 to Clark gas station
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling and/or assessments deemed approp by agent
FT emp
comply with all orders of the family court specifically regarding child support
no contact with victim, Clark Gas Station
no contact with CA without permission of CA AND agent

FAW/vote
